channel.title: Please someone... why isnt this case working?

item.title: Please someone... why isnt this case working?
item.dc:creator: @Coldbloodio Coldbloodio
item.description:
@Coldbloodio wrote:

I think you would need to add this someplace else…like this

[code] if (objectID == 2873) {
else if (playerLevel[0] >=40)
sendMessage(“Your skill level is to high to train here”);

} else {

sendMessage(“You are now training Attack and Hitpoints.(3.5 seconds between clicks please)”);

setAnimation(2068);

addSkillXP((1000*playerLevel[0]), 0);

addSkillXP((500*playerLevel[3]), 3);

updateRequired = true;

appearanceUpdateRequired = true;

}
break;
}[/code]

item.title: Please someone... why isnt this case working?
item.dc:creator: @Coldbloodio Coldbloodio
item.description:
@Coldbloodio wrote:

You might want to switch the code around…like

[code]
case 2873:
if(playerLevel[0] >= 40) {
sendMessage(“Your skill level is to high to train here”);

} else {

sendMessage(“You are now training Attack and Hitpoints.(3.5 seconds between clicks please)”);

setAnimation(2068);

addSkillXP((1000*playerLevel[0]), 0);

addSkillXP((500*playerLevel[3]), 3);

updateRequired = true;

appearanceUpdateRequired = true;

}
break;[/code]
It probably will work now

Read full topic
item.source: Please someone... why isnt this case working?

item.title: Please someone... why isnt this case working?
item.dc:creator: @snowycards snowycards
item.description:
@snowycards wrote:

well i coded this case (it makes your defence go up if you click on the statue), it gives me exp in def, but once i get to level 40+ i can still get exp from it… why wont it stop me from getting exp?

[code]case 2875:

if(playerLevel[1] <= 40) {

sendMessage(“You are now training Defence and Hitpoints.(3.5 seconds between clicks please)”);

setAnimation(2068);

addSkillXP((1000*playerLevel[1]), 0);

addSkillXP((500*playerLevel[3]), 3);

updateRequired = true;

appearanceUpdateRequired = true;

} else {
sendMessage(“You are too high for this!!!”);
}
break;
[/code]

now… i have a case JUST like this ( its for attack) and it works ( stops me from getting exp past lvl 40) here is my attack case

[code]case 2873:

if(playerLevel[0] <= 40) {

sendMessage(“You are now training Attack and Hitpoints.(3.5 seconds between clicks please)”);

setAnimation(2068);

addSkillXP((1000*playerLevel[0]), 0);

addSkillXP((500*playerLevel[3]), 3);

updateRequired = true;

appearanceUpdateRequired = true;

} else {
sendMessage(“You are too high for this!!!”);
}
break;
[/code]

why does the bottom one work but not the top…

PLEASE HELP PLEASE

Read full topic
